sentence.text: Breast tissue and blood from patients with invasive breast cancer (n = 38) and benign breast disease (n = 30) were compared with those from healthy individuals (n = 36), matched with the cancer patients by age at diagnosis, ethnicity, body cell adhesion mediated by integrin index, menopausal status and familial history of cancer.

Tumor-specific methylation changes at positive regulation of cell proliferation protein deubiquitination2 were observed in 59% of cancer patients, IGF2 DMR0 in 38%, regulation of cyclin-dependent protein serine/threonine kinase activity DMR in 36%, negative regulation of Wnt signaling pathway ICR in 23%, PEG3 DMR in 21%, MEST ICR in 19%, H19 ICR in 18%, KvDMR in 8% and SNRPN/SNURF ICR in 4%.

entity.text: regulation of cyclin-dependent protein serine/threonine kinase activity
negative regulation of Wnt signaling pathway
